com.navis.framework.persistence.util

Class DatabaseUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.util.DatabaseUtils

  • public class DatabaseUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains convenience methods for database utilities classes like DatabaseHelper, Performance Pack classes and Index management system classes
    Author:
    Andrey Ignatenko, May 22, 2009

      • convertToCarinaIndexes

        public static java.util.List<ICarinaIndex> convertToCarinaIndexes(java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> inIndexes,
                                                                  DatabaseType inDatabaseType)
        This method converts fetched from the database index info into list of ICarinaIndex classes. The assumption is that fetched indexes sorted by tableName, columnName and column position in index
        Parameters:
        inIndexes - List of maps containing database indexes info
        inDatabaseType - database type
        Returns:
        ICarinaIndex objects

      • checkLobMapping

        public static void checkLobMapping(org.hibernate.metadata.ClassMetadata inMetaData,
                                   java.lang.StringBuilder inOutBuf)
        This method checks if LOB data types were correctly declared in HBM files and DB has valid LOB columns. This method for testing only. Since it uses DatabaseHelper, it should not be used in production code
        Parameters:
        inMetaData - metadata for a table definition
        inOutBuf - collects errors

public static java.lang.StringBuilder checkAndFixSpatialIndexesDefinition()
        This validates if all spatial columns have declared indexes. It tries to create missed indexes.
        Returns:
        collected errors

        collected errors

        Returns:

        This method convert value from JDBC to double. It could be either BigDecimal or double. Any other cases, including NULL will be converted to zero
        Parameters:
        inValue - value from JDBC query to convert
        Returns:
        double value

      • getTablesToExcludeFormIndexView

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTablesToExcludeFormIndexView()
        This method is created because Hibernate may create composite indexes for PK in inverse order. For instance following DDL is generated, where order of columns in PK is different from the column order

        create table frm_job_group_node ( jobgroupGkey bigint not null, clusterServiceGkey bigint not null, primary key (clusterServiceGkey, jobgroupGkey) ) ;

        When we read PK from HBM table definition class, it shows expected order. So, created database index is different from expected and Index view displays this discrepancy. It was decided to exclude this table from testing and view, otherwise a Hibernate fix is required.

        Returns:
        list of tables to ignore in Carina IndexManagement system

      • estimateColumnAlteringTime

        public static void estimateColumnAlteringTime(java.lang.String inTableName,
                                              java.lang.String inColumnName)
        This method roughly estimates timing for altering a column
        Parameters:
        inTableName - the table to alter
        inColumnName - the column to modify

      • getMaxRowSizeFromDatabase

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Integer getMaxRowSizeFromDatabase(java.lang.String inTableName)
        This method calculates the maximum row size of a given SQL Server table
        Parameters:
        inTableName - table name
        Returns:
        row size of the table

      • getSqlserverTableColumnInfo

        public static java.util.List getSqlserverTableColumnInfo(java.lang.String inTableName)
        This method fetches table info including custom columns from system tables. This is for sqlserver only
        Parameters:
        inTableName - table name
        Returns:
        list of column info

      • getSqlserverTableColumnInfoNoCustomColumn

        public static java.util.List getSqlserverTableColumnInfoNoCustomColumn(java.lang.String inTableName)
        This method fetches table info excluding custom columns from system tables. This is for sqlserver only
        Parameters:
        inTableName - table name
        Returns:
        list of column info

      • getColumnSizeForIndexCalculation

        @NotNull
public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getColumnSizeForIndexCalculation(java.lang.String inTableName)
        A method to return a given table's column name with its size. This is specifically used for calculating index sizes. The column size may be different from the actual declared column size in DB. Don't use it to get the column size for other purposes. Currently tested with Sql Server only
        Parameters:
        inTableName - Table name as string
        Returns:
        A map of column name and its size

      • getMaxBytesForDatabaseType

        public static int getMaxBytesForDatabaseType(java.lang.String inDataType,
                                             java.lang.Integer inMaxLength)
        This method number of bytes taken by a data type. It may not cover other databases, definetly works for sqlserver. We don't need measure other database types for now.
        Parameters:
        inDataType - data type
        inMaxLength - max length , -1 if unknown
        Returns:
        number of bytes to keep this data type in the database
